001package io.avaje.inject.spi;
002
003import org.mockito.Mockito;
004
005import jakarta.inject.Named;
006import java.util.function.Consumer;
007
008/**
009 * Holds beans supplied to the dependency injection.
010 * <p>
011 * These are typically test doubles or mock instances that we supply in testing.
012 * When we supply bean instances they take precedence over other beans that
013 * would normally be injected.
014 * </p>
015 */
016public class SuppliedBean<B> {
017
018  private final String name;
019
020  private final Class<B> type;
021
022  private final Consumer<B> consumer;
023
024  private B bean;
025
026  /**
027   * Create with a given target type and bean instance.
028   */
029  public SuppliedBean(String name, Class<B> type, B bean) {
030    this(name, type, bean, null);
031  }
032
033  /**
034   * Create with a consumer to setup the mock.
035   */
036  public SuppliedBean(String name, Class<B> type, B bean, Consumer<B> consumer) {
037    this.name = name;
038    this.type = type;
039    this.bean = bean;
040    this.consumer = consumer;
041  }
042
043  /**
044   * Return the dependency injection target type.
045   */
046  public Class<B> getType() {
047    return type;
048  }
049
050  /**
051   * Return the bean instance to use (often a test double or mock).
052   */
053  public B getBean() {
054    if (bean == null) {
055      // should extract a SPI for this
056      bean = Mockito.mock(type);
057    }
058    if (consumer != null) {
059      consumer.accept(bean);
060    }
061    return bean;
062  }
063
064  /**
065   * Return the qualifier name of the supplied bean.
066   */
067  public String name() {
068    if (name != null) {
069      return name;
070    }
071    Named annotation = type.getAnnotation(Named.class);
072    return (annotation == null) ? null : annotation.value();
073  }
074}
